techmeme.title: Filing: Meta agrees to settle a 2022 lawsuit by Texas accusing Meta of using facial recognition tech to collect biometric data of Texans without their consent (Mike Scarcella/Reuters)
President Biden vetoes a bill overturning SAB 121, a controversial SEC bulletin that establishes accounting standards for companies that custody crypto (Sarah Wynn/The Block)
Researchers say a threat actor claims to have hacked Ticketmaster and Santander using stolen credentials of a Snowflake employee; Snowflake disputes the claims (Sergiu Gatlan/BleepingComputer)
Hacking group ShinyHunters offers to sell alleged data of Santander staff and 30M customers; Santander warned on May 14 that a database had been compromised (Owen Walker/Financial Times)
Filing: Ticketmaster confirms "unauthorized activity within a third-party cloud database", after a hacking group advertised alleged data of 560M users for sale (Joseph Cox/404 Media)
